metadata.synopsis: When legendary Inspector Clouseau (Roger Moore) goes missing, New York police officer Clifton Sleigh (Ted Wass) is enlisted to find him. But Sleigh turns out to be the only detective in the world more incompetent than Clouseau himself. Traveling to France, Sleigh bumbles his way into and out of trouble, while encountering a number of characters from Clouseau's past, including the charismatic jewel thief Charles Litton (David Niven) and his womanizing nephew, George (Robert Wagner).

reviews: One of the weaker entries in the series.
there's more to Clouseau than just making a mess of things
may God have mercy on Blake's soul
The curse is the absence of Peter Sellers. Poor Niven is dubbed.
The magic is gone without Peter Sellers.
There's a special corner of hell reserved for people who try to do Clouseau without Sellers.
Yeah, I know. But I fell out of my seat laughing at the ending.
Yes, because we all know that the American equivalent to Peter Sellers is ... Ted Wass.
